Job Details Description Director of Sponsorship Sales - Chick-fil-A College Football Hall of Fame LEGENDS Founded in 2008, Legends is a premium experiences company with more than 1,500 full-time and 30,000 seasonal team members globally. Legends has six divisions operating worldwide - Global Planning, Global Sales, Hospitality, Global Partnerships, Global Merchandise, and Global Technology Solutions - offering clients and partners a 360-degree service solution platform to elevate their brand and execute their vision. Currently, Legends works with marquee clients across business verticals including professional sports; collegiate; attractions; entertainment; and conventions and leisure. We are the industry leaders in designing, planning and realizing exceptional experiences in sports and entertainment. VENUE Atlanta Hall Management, Inc. (AHM), a 501(c)(3), operates the Chick-fil-A College Football Hall of Fame, located in the heart of downtown Atlanta across from Centennial Olympic Park. The Hall opened its doors in August 2014 and has secured its reputation as one of the nation's most engaging and interactive experiences. The Chick-fil-A College Football Hall of Fame's mission is to entertain, educate and inspire in a way that celebrates, honors and preserves the people, traditions and passions of college football. THE ROLE The College Football Hall of Fame is seeking a Director of Sponsorship Sales or to join our team to effectively drive strategic business partnerships to meet our revenue goals. The Director of Sponsorship Sales must be self-motivated with proven experience in generating revenue from corporate partnerships. Candidate must have demonstrated creativity in developing valuable partnership opportunities by leveraging available assets or creating new ones. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Develop fully-integrated, customized sponsorship platforms based on the specific and unique business challenges for each prospect, utilizing all assets to help fulfill the client business objectives. Pioneer new categories, inventory, campaigns and partner integrations Draw on a list of contacts developed from past sponsorship experiences and develop/cultivate new corporate marketing prospects to pursue revenue. Research, prospect and establish leads for corporate relationships followed by an introductory needs analysis/discovery meeting utilizing a consultative sales approach. Communicate with executive staff and stakeholders to coordinate meetings and touchpoints throughout the sales process. Continually keep abreast of sports marketing trends and knowledge of the marketplace. Works closely with other departments within the organization on corporate partner related programs including fan experience/operations, public relations, and marketing. Prepares weekly sales reports and participates in College Football Hall of Fame activities, events and meetings. Capable and available to work extended hours including nights, weekends, and holidays as necessary and attend conferences and special events as needed Other duties and projects as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty above at the highest levels. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor's Degree required Minimum of 3 years sales experience with corporate sponsorship experience a plus Ability to successfully manage multiple customers and meet short deadlines Ability to establish and maintain strong working corporate relationships with senior level managers/clients Self-motivated team player with a proven ability to work with aggressive individual and team sales goals Proven track record pitching, negotiating and closing long-term six to seven figure partnerships Must have strong interpersonal communication skills Excellent oral, written and presentation skills Knowledge of sports marketing and types of sponsor inventory Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Possess superior negotiation skills coupled with a net profit bottom line mentality Must be creative, detail oriented, possess a strong work ethic, and be willing to learn Solutions oriented problem-solving mentality a must 15-20% travel required Valid driver's license with an acceptable driving record is required COMPENSATION Competitive salary, commensurate with experience, and a generous benefits package that includes:
medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid vacation, and 401k plan.
